name: Cody AI by Codex Solutions
title: Cody AI by Codex Solutions
description: How to integrate Cody AI with Make.com

children.text: Cody is an AI assistant that can be trained on a company’s knowledge base to automate support, answer questions, and assist teams across various roles, making it valuable for Make.com users seeking customizable, workflow-integrated AI automation and knowledge management.
This is AI-generated content based on official Cody AI documentation. The content may still contain errors—please verify important information. If you have questions, contact
How to get support on Cody AI

Cody AI is a community-developed application and is subjected to the developer's terms and conditions, which may include applicable fees. Make does not maintain or support this integration. For assistance, please https://f.make.com/r/reachout?app_name=Cody%20AI&app_slug=cody-ai-community&app_unique_id=codyai-je0du0.
To use the Cody AI app in Make,
you must have an active account and an API Key,
create your account on Cody AI.
To install this app, you need Admin, Owner, or App Developer permissions.
the on-screen instructions to complete the setup.
To get started, you must first create a connection between Cody AI and
, allowing the two services to communicate.
You can connect using the following method: API Keys.
You need to retrieve your API key from your account.
Login to your platform using your credentials.
Navigate to your API Keys page.
Some community developers require an additional specific
from the community developer's dashboard, generally found under
, add the Cody AI module to your
If you add a module with an instant tag, click
field, enter a name for the connection.
you copied from your Cody AI or follow the on-screen instructions to create the connection. You must also enter any required third-party API keys obtained earlier.
For detailed information on connecting an application, see
After connecting to the Cody AI app, you can choose from a list of available modules to build your
Sure! This module lets you create a brand new conversation, making it easy to start fresh discussions or support threads whenever you need.
This module allows you to create a brand new document, either as plain text or in HTML format. Simply provide the content you want, and the module will generate the document for you.
Creates a new folder in your specified location, helping you organize your files more efficiently.
Delete a conversation using its unique ID—this module lets you permanently remove a specific conversation from your system by specifying its identifier.
Deletes a specific document from your database using its unique ID.
Retrieve a specific conversation by entering its unique ID. This module allows you to access all the details of a particular conversation based on the ID you provide.
Retrieve a specific document using its unique ID. This module allows you to access and view the details of a particular document by providing its identification number.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific folder using its unique ID.
Retrieves a complete list of all the bots available in your account, allowing you to view and manage them as needed.
Retrieves a complete list of all conversations, allowing you to view and manage every conversation in your account.
Retrieve all documents from your selected source, allowing you to access and work with the complete list of available files.
Retrieve a complete list of all folders from your account, allowing you to view and manage your folder structure easily.
Retrieves a list of all messages, allowing you to view and manage every message within your account.
Sure! Please provide the original text or module description you'd like me to rephrase.
Update the details of an existing conversation using its unique ID. This module lets you modify specific information within a conversation, ensuring your records stay accurate and up to date.
Update the details of a specific folder using its unique ID.

, where you'll find thousands of pre-created

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.
